description: The Unemployment Insurance (UI) wage record data is a federal-state administrative dataset compiled primarily by the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) in collaboration with state unemployment insurance programs. It contains detailed records of wages, employment durations, and employer information for workers covered under state and federal UI laws. Key features include longitudinal tracking of individual earnings, employer liability assessments for unemployment taxes, and, in some states, enhanced data like job titles, hours worked, and workplace locations. The dataset’s primary purpose is to administer UI programs, ensuring accurate tax revenue collection and benefit distribution. Beyond this core function, it serves as a critical resource for labor market analysis, enabling studies on employment trends, wage growth, job quality, and the economic impact of workforce programs. For example, it has been used to evaluate outcomes for participants in job training initiatives. Unique aspects include its near-universal coverage (capturing ~96% of civilian wage and salary data) and its dual role as both an operational tool and a statistical resource. The BLS’s Wage Records Program standardizes and aggregates these records, while states may add supplementary fields. This dataset underpins reports like the Quarterly Census of Employment and Wages (QCEW) and supports policy decisions by providing granular insights into labor market dynamics.
aliases: Bls Wage Records Data Sharing Program
Bureau of Labor Statistics Wage Records Program Dataset
organizations: Commission on Enhancing the Use of Administrative Data for Evidence Building
